{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3471118,"name":"Falon Clark","username":"Tatiman-Dev","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tatiman-dev/{size}/236095_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-05T18:39:25.789Z","cooked":"

Hello! Does anyone have any ideas for sourcing the bevel-esque gears used for differential arms, I’m thinking something like the final joint of 1690’s 2023 arm. We have been thinking about 3D printing them, but we’re not sure if that’s a smart decision, we’ve had issues with 3D printed gears in the past.

If anyone has advice/sources/info for designing and sourcing parts for differential arms, I’d appreciate it a lot!

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-05T18:39:25.789Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":61,"reads":214,"readers_count":213,"score":347.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":479030,"topic_slug":"differential-arm-gear-sourcing-guide","display_username":"Falon Clark","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57393,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"The Kotlin Guy"},"post_url":"/t/differential-arm-gear-sourcing-guide/479030/1","custom_user_title":"The Kotlin Guy","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3471124,"name":"Evan Rong","username":"EvanRongg","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/evanrongg/{size}/260481_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-05T18:45:22.908Z","cooked":"

What material are you planning on using for your bevel gears? My team learned that using PLA, ABS or any “standard” printing material was too fragile if the gear were to be under a lot of load. Which caused the gear to have a short life expectancy and frequent swapping of the gear.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2025-01-05T18:45:22.908Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":203,"readers_count":202,"score":50.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":479030,"topic_slug":"differential-arm-gear-sourcing-guide","display_username":"Evan Rong","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":62900,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/differential-arm-gear-sourcing-guide/479030/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3471126,"name":"Falon Clark","username":"Tatiman-Dev","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tatiman-dev/{size}/236095_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-05T18:46:28.696Z","cooked":"

How frequent is frequent? I dont think its entirely ridiculous to swap them out every few matches. I’m not sure what our options are for metal ones using krakens, because of SplineXS.

We have also considered using SLS nylon 3d printed gears

Do you have a picture of the thing you’re trying to source and/or the arm your trying to make? This sounds interesting.

I would just design around off the shelf swerve bevel gears tbh. Sure there ARE better options, but it is hard to beat the availability from places you are likely ordering from anyways.

Beyond that:
KEK

I will note: there are a lot of ways to make a differential, however you are probably interested in the 90° aspect of making one with bevel gearing, so that may be a natural fit
